 Dimension of a neuron model table. More...

Detailed Description

Precalculated table of a neuron model.

This class abstract the behaviour of a neuron model table. These tables are used for access to the behaviour of a neuron model. These tables are loaded from a file and externally generated.

Author:
Jesus Garrido

Richard Carrillo

Date:
August 2008

Member Function Documentation

void NeuronModelTable::LoadTable ( FILE *  fd  )  throw (EDLUTException)

It loads a neuron model table.

It loads the neuron model table values from the .dat file.

Parameters:
fd Neuron model table file descriptor.
Precondition:
The file descriptor must be where this table starts, so this is thought for loading all tables in order.
Postcondition:
The file descriptor is where this table description ends.
Exceptions:
EDLUTException If something wrong happens.

void NeuronModelTable::LoadTableDescription ( FILE *  fh,
long &  Currentline 
) throw (EDLUTFileException)

It loads the table description from a file.

It loads the table description from a .cfg file.

Parameters:
fh The file descriptor of the neuron model table description.
Currentline The line in the file where we are reading (for error description reasons).
Precondition:
The file descriptor must be where this table description starts, so this is thought for loading all tables in order.
Postcondition:
The file descriptor is where this table description ends.

Currentline is modified with the next line in the file.

void NeuronModelTable::GenerateVirtualCoordinates (  )  throw (EDLUTException) [private]

It generates the virtual coordinates of the table.

This funcion generates the virtual coordinates of the table. That is necessary for correctly accessing to the interpolated dimensions.

Exceptions:
EDLUTException If something wrong happens.
